creator: Marina Temkin
title: (No AI) InScope nabs $14.5M to solve the pain of financial reporting
dc:creator: Marina Temkin
content: The startup, founded by accountants who worked at Flexport, Miro, Hopin and Thrive Global, automates the difficulties of prepping financial statements.
contentSnippet: The startup, founded by accountants who worked at Flexport, Miro, Hopin and Thrive Global, automates the difficulties of prepping financial statements.

creator: Russell Brandom
title: (No AI) Great news for xAI: Grok is now pretty good at answering questions about Baldur’s Gate
dc:creator: Russell Brandom
content: A new report from Business Insider reveals that high-level engineers at xAI were pulled off other projects to make sure Grok could answer detailed questions about the video game Baldur's Gate.
contentSnippet: A new report from Business Insider reveals that high-level engineers at xAI were pulled off other projects to make sure Grok could answer detailed questions about the video game Baldur's Gate.

title: (No AI) Trump is making coal plants even dirtier as AI demands more energy
author: Justine Calma
content:
![A photo of emissions rising from coal plant along a lake shore. ](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/gettyimages-1140674387.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Kingston Fossil Plant, a 1.4-gigawatt coal-fired power plant located in Roane County, just outside Kingston, Tennessee on the shore of Watts Bar Lake. | Photo: Getty Images

The Trump administration just tossed out Biden-era restrictions on mercury and other toxic pollutants from power plants. It's repealing [Mercury and Air Toxics Standards](https://www.epa.gov/stationary-sources-air-pollution/mercury-and-air-toxics-standards) (MATS) just as [electricity demand in the US ticks up](https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=65264) with the buildout of new AI data centers.

Those standards are particularly impactful when it comes to pollution from coal plants [responsible for around half of mercury emissions](https://19january2017snapshot.epa.gov/mercury/basic-information-about-mercury_.html) in the US. Mercury is a neurotoxin; high exposure has been [linked to birth defects and learning disabilities in children](https://wwwn.cdc.gov/TSP/ToxFAQs/ToxFAQsDetails.aspx?faqid=113&toxid=24). Exposure can also impact the kidneys and nervous system.

> Trump's deregulation spree aims to make it easier to quickly constr …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/science/882288/trump-ai-data-center-power-plant-pollution-mercury-mats)
contentSnippet:
Kingston Fossil Plant, a 1.4-gigawatt coal-fired power plant located in Roane County, just outside Kingston, Tennessee on the shore of Watts Bar Lake. | Photo: Getty Images	

The Trump administration just tossed out Biden-era restrictions on mercury and other toxic pollutants from power plants. It's repealing Mercury and Air Toxics Standards (MATS) just as electricity demand in the US ticks up with the buildout of new AI data centers. 
Those standards are particularly impactful when it comes to pollution from coal plants responsible for around half of mercury emissions in the US. Mercury is a neurotoxin; high exposure has been linked to birth defects and learning disabilities in children. Exposure can also impact the kidneys and nervous system.

Trump's deregulation spree aims to make it easier to quickly constr …

Read the full story at The Verge.

It's repealing Mercury and Air Toxics Standards (MATS) just as electricity demand in the US ticks up with the buildout of new AI data centers. Those standards are particularly impactful when it comes to pollution from coal plants […]

title: (No AI) Amazon blames human employees for an AI coding agent’s mistake
author: Robert Hart
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/STKB371_AMAZON_WEB_SERVICES_A.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Amazon Web Services suffered a 13-hour outage to one system in December as a result of its AI coding assistant Kiro's actions, [according to the _Financial Times_](https://www.ft.com/content/00c282de-ed14-4acd-a948-bc8d6bdb339d). Numerous unnamed Amazon employees told the _FT_ that AI agent Kiro was responsible for the December incident affecting an AWS service in parts of mainland China. People familiar with the matter said the tool chose to "delete and recreate the environment" it was working on, which caused the outage.

While Kiro normally requires sign-off from two humans to push changes, the bot had the permissions of its operator, and a human error there allowed more access than expected.

Amazon describ …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/882005/amazon-blames-human-employees-for-an-ai-coding-agents-mistake)

title: (No AI) Advancing independent research on AI alignment
content: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.

creator: Steven Levy
title: (No AI) AI Safety Meets the War Machine
dc:creator: Steven Levy
content: Anthropic doesn’t want its AI used in autonomous weapons or government surveillance. Those carve-outs could cost it a major military contract.
contentSnippet: Anthropic doesn’t want its AI used in autonomous weapons or government surveillance. Those carve-outs could cost it a major military contract.

creator: Rhett Allain
title: (No AI) Could AI Data Centers Be Moved to Outer Space?
dc:creator: Rhett Allain
content: Massive data centers for generative AI are bad for the Earth. How about launching them into orbit?
contentSnippet: Massive data centers for generative AI are bad for the Earth. How about launching them into orbit?
